steps.text: Who first brought Nashville's music to the world?
steps.shortText: Find the forgotten stars of Nashville's music history.

steps.text:
Who first brought Nashville's music to the world?

Fisk Jubilee Singers

Formed in the late 1860s at Nashville’s Fisk University, this vocal ensemble took spirituals beyond Tennessee and introduced them to audiences worldwide. Their groundbreaking tours funded the university’s mission to educate people newly freed from enslavement—and, as legend has it, upon playing for the Queen of England, the queen stated the Fisk Jubilee Singers must come from a \"City of Music.\" More than 150 years later, the Fisk Jubilee Singers continue to perform, preserving their stirring harmonies and sustaining the tradition that first placed Nashville on the global music map.
Arrange the symbols correctly to decode the secret to preserving Tennessee’s legacy.
steps.shortText: Arrange the symbols correctly to decode their secret.

steps.text:
Essence Of Tennessee

Well done!

You’ve uncovered the proper order of Tennessee’s emblems.

Use the key below to decode the secret to preserving Tennessee’s legacy.

What’s the secret to preserving Tennessee’s legacy

Archiving!

The Library & Archives collects and preserves books and records of historical, documentary and reference value, and encourages and promotes library development throughout the state. Free and open to the public, the Library & Archives invites you to explore Tennessee’s story through interactive exhibits showcasing the state’s most treasured documents.

Find the park’s tribute to the 31 rivers that carved Tennessee’s story. Locate each river in the puzzle, then look closely between their paths for a hidden phrase revealing why these waters flow so deeply in the state’s heritage.
steps.shortText: Discover the tribute to Tennessee's rivers and their significance.

steps.text:
Why do these waters flow so deeply in Tennessee’s heritage?

UNITED BY WATERWAYS

The paths carved by Tennessee’s rivers have bridged towns, carried commerce, and brought people together for centuries. By rediscovering these waters, you’ve woven another essential thread back into our collective story.

A set of once-grand pillars lie exposed in this park, undone by the very forces they were built to withstand. Find them, uncover why they lost their original home, and reveal a hidden clue about the role they once served at a historic Tennessee landmark.
steps.shortText: Uncover the story behind the exposed pillars and their original purpose.

steps.text:
What role did these once grand pillars play?

FOUNDATION

These worn pillars once held up more than stone—they carried the weight of a growing state. By tracing their history and the forces that shaped their downfall, you’ve uncovered the forgotten groundwork of Tennessee’s Capitol. Even in ruin, they remind us what strong foundations can endure.
What lifted Tennessee’s future into the skies?
steps.shortText: What lifted Tennessee’s future into the skies?

steps.text:
What lifted Tennessee’s future into the skies?

AVAIATION ERA

From dirt runways to global hubs, Tennessee’s Aviation Era transformed how people and goods moved across the state. The echoes of this airborne expansion still shape our world today—though many of its airfields have vanished from the map, you’ve brought this high-flying legacy back into view.

Where did lives once converge?

McNAIRY SPRING

This natural spring has drawn life to this spot for centuries. Long before Nashville became a city—or Tennessee a state—people and animals alike gathered here. Its steady waters made it a vital meeting place, a source of sustenance, and ultimately the reason this location was chosen as the state’s capital. Though the spring is now hidden, its legacy continues to shape the land and the stories we remember.
What brought Tennessee’s 100th birthday celebration to life?
steps.shortText: Discover what brought Tennessee’s 100th birthday celebration to life.

steps.text:
What brought Tennessee’s 100th birthday celebration to life?

EXPOSITION

Held in 1897, the Tennessee Centennial Exposition was a grand celebration of the state’s first hundred years. Thousands came to Nashville to see new inventions, listen to music, and walk the elaborate fairgrounds. The event left behind more than memories—it gave the city its full-scale Parthenon and helped shape its future as a cultural capital.
What word connects all of Tennessee?
steps.shortText: What word connects all of Tennessee?

steps.text:
What word connects all of Tennessee?

VOLUNTEER

The Volunteer State.
Tennessee earned its nickname during the War of 1812, when an overwhelming number of Tennesseans volunteered to join the fight—so many, in fact, that the name stuck. That spirit of service didn’t stop there. From the Mexican-American War to moments of disaster relief and civic duty, Tennesseans have consistently stepped forward when called. “Volunteer” isn’t just a name—it’s a legacy of commitment, pride, and readiness to serve that continues to define the state today.
